questions.question: Is the Viking ship displayed as artwork on the front cover of a rectangular board game box?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the Viking ship is prominently displayed on the front of a board game box. The arrangement and perspective indicate that it is indeed intended as the main visual feature of the game's cover. The image of the Viking ship is centered and presented in a way typical for board game covers, which commonly use thematic artwork related to the game's content.

questions.question: Are Norse motifs such as runic patterns, interlacing designs, or dragon heads visibly integrated into the artwork of the ship on the box?
questions.explanation: Upon analyzing Image B, it is evident that the Viking ship artwork on the box includes several Norse motifs. The dragon heads are particularly noticeable at both the bow and stern. Additionally, the sail features a circular knotwork pattern consistent with traditional Norse design. These elements are characteristic of Norse artwork and are integrated into the shipâ€™s design.

questions.question: Is the title "Voyage of the Vikings" displayed in bold, readable typography on the box cover?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the title 'Voyage of the Vikings' is shown in large, bold typography across the upper portion of the box cover. The font size and style make it very readable and it draws attention immediately, which is typical for board game titles to ensure visibility and readability.

questions.question: Is the circular knotwork pattern from the sail used as part of a game board layout, such as a grid or path system, within the box artwork?
questions.explanation: Image B shows the circular knotwork pattern prominently on the sail of the Viking ship, but there is no indication or visual cues in the box artwork suggesting that this pattern is used as a part of a game board layout, such as a grid or path system. The pattern is decorative and appears to be part of the ship's design rather than a functional game element.

questions.question: Are there small, stylized figures resembling the rowers placed along the ship's side or on the game board area?
questions.explanation: In Image B, small, stylized figures resembling rowers can be seen along the side of the Viking ship depicted on the game box artwork. These figures are aligned as if they are rowing, consistent with the design of Viking ships traditionally crewed by oarsmen.

questions.question: Do the side panels of the game box feature a visible wooden texture or grain pattern?
questions.explanation: Image B shows the side panels of the game box, and there is no visible wooden texture or grain pattern. The side panels are decorated with thematic artwork and font, matching the styling of the front cover, but do not mimic wood texture.
